intro: Hieracium oelvense, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium oelvense is often found in open meadows and on slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
